musicalLanguage.description: The debut single that launched Alicia Keys' career — a raw, emotional piano ballad built on a hypnotic two-chord ostinato. The simplicity of the harmonic foundation lets the vocal and piano interplay shine.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro - Verse - Chorus - Verse - Chorus - Bridge - Chorus - Outro
keyMoments: Intro: the haunting Em-Bm piano figure that anchors the entire song
Verse: the piano holds steady while the vocal builds intensity
Chorus: 'I keep on fallin'' — the melody soars over the repeating figure
teachingGoals: Two-chord ostinato patterns with rhythmic variation
Building intensity through dynamics, not complexity
styleTips: The two-chord pattern must groove, not plod — vary the rhythm subtly each time
Build dynamics gradually through the verse into the chorus
The left hand is the heartbeat — keep it absolutely steady
